BackUpDialog.synopsis: After fighting the Bhaal Cultists, the Netherbrain has a chat with the player via a tadpoled Flaming Fist Runner in case Captain Edenosa died to the cultists. The Netherbrain explains why it got one of its tadpoled minions to intervene and that it is trying to break through the netherstones restrictions. The conversation is clearly causing a lot of strain to both the Netherbrain and to the Flaming Fist.
BackUpDialog.how_to_trigger: If Captain Edenosa is dead after the end of the Bhaal cultists ambush in the Lower City Park, a Flaming Fist Runner spawns off screen and runs towards the players. When it spots one, it starts this dialog.

003.synopsis: After fighting the Bhaal Cultists, the Netherbrain has a chat with the player via Captain Edenosa and explains why it helped. The conversation is clearly causing a lot of strain to both the Netherbrain and to Edenosa.
003.how_to_trigger: Dialogue automatically triggers if Captain Edenosa is alive after the end of the Bhaal cultists ambush in the Lower City Park.

002.synopsis: Mid combat dialogue between the Bhaal Cultists who are attacking the Players and tadpoled Flaming Fist Mercenaries who come in to aid the Players. Players mostly just watch the exchange and learn about the infighting between the tadpoled Absolutists and the Bhaal Cultists
002.how_to_trigger: Automatically triggers at the start of the combat round after the Flaming Fists join the initiative in the combat against the Cultists in the Park ambush. Teleport to S_Debug_LOW_Park and walk towards waterfall a tthe rear to start the ambush sequence.

001.synopsis: The player is confronted by some Bhaalist cutlists who've just murdered a civilian in Bloomridge park. The cultists recognise the player as even greater targets - those Orin wants dead. They turn hostile, with more appearing after the dialogue, leaving the player outnumbered.
001.how_to_trigger: Player walks in to the area of the murder/ambush at the rear of the park

BackUpDialog_38.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_38.text: What's going on here? Someone raised the -
BackUpDialog_38.context: NodeContext: Alert/officious. Sentence cut off at the end by a mindmeld. (would have said 'someone raised the alarm')

BackUpDialog_31.speaker: Narrator
BackUpDialog_31.text: *You feel a familiar squirm deep in your mind. She has a tadpole - but something grasps at it. Something powerful.*
BackUpDialog_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld FX. The flaming fist grimaces in discomfort.

BackUpDialog_15.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_15.text:
-- Quick - Must be
-- quick --This mind i---s small -- fragile as an egg. Listen now.
BackUpDialog_15.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_12.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_12.text: -- You know us - absolute WILL --- Absolute power ---
BackUpDialog_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Breaks off mid-sentence to grimace in painNodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_18.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_18.text:
--- not much time - left - this mind cannot bear US
-- Turns to liquid --- Listen close -
BackUpDialog_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Resumes speaking, while wincing through painNodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_11.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_11.text:
-- We learn -- We grow - loosen our clumsy bindings -
--- AID US ---
BackUpDialog_11.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_9.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_9.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_0.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_0.text:
-- necromancer - dead --- - tyrant fallen --
-- only changeling remains ---- KILL HER -
BackUpDialog_0.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_5.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_5.text:
-- YOU--- have a place -
--- in my Grand Design -
BackUpDialog_5.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_14.speaker: Lae'zel
BackUpDialog_14.text: This elder brain can use the tadpole to seize minds. What more is that abomination capable of?

BackUpDialog_13.speaker: Karlach
BackUpDialog_13.text: The elder brain can control anyone with a tadpole. That's... concerning.

BackUpDialog_2.speaker: Jaheira
BackUpDialog_2.text: Ugh - the elder brain works its will through the worm. What other tricks has it learned?

BackUpDialog_7.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_7.text: So many... so many of them... They love me...
BackUpDialog_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: The fist looks dazed, released from the netherbrain's possession. NodeContext: Suddenly returning to his old self, but dazed and raptuous. (He drops dead shortly the dialogue his brain overwhelmed)

BackUpDialog_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
BackUpDialog_3.text: The elder brain uses the infected like puppets. Such tremendous power.

BackUpDialog_19.speaker: Wyll
BackUpDialog_19.text: Her mind, gone in an instant - the elder brain holds phenomenal power. There's no telling what it's capable of.

BackUpDialog_23.speaker: Shadowheart
BackUpDialog_23.text: The elder brain's working her like a damn string puppet. What else is it capable of...?

BackUpDialog_24.speaker: Gale
BackUpDialog_24.text: Made into a mouthpiece by the elder brain itself. The merest taste of its manipulations, I fear.

BackUpDialog_32.speaker: Astarion
BackUpDialog_32.text: The elder brain turned her into a meat puppet. What the hells else can it do...

BackUpDialog_33.speaker: Minsc
BackUpDialog_33.text: Ugh. Minsc would rather crack his own skull than let it be some squishy illithid plaything. What other perversions does this elder brain commit?

BackUpDialog_39.speaker: Halsin
BackUpDialog_39.text: Her free will gone, as soon as the elder brain willed it. What else is it capable of...?

BackUpDialog_17.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_17.text:
-- necromancer - dead --- - changeling fallen --
-- only tyrant remains ---- KILL HIM -
BackUpDialog_17.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_37.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_37.text:
-- necromancer - dead --- - changeling and tyrant remain --
-- at odds ---- KILL THEM -
BackUpDialog_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grimacing intensely on rhe last sentence. Communication getting more difficultNodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_6.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_6.text:
--- Inconsequential -- Just a vessel -- - One of many -
-- It will perish - We will survive -
- We are the power that links you all ---
BackUpDialog_6.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

BackUpDialog_27.speaker: Player
BackUpDialog_27.text: Use your parasite. Peer into her mind.

BackUpDialog_16.speaker: Player
BackUpDialog_16.text: Use your parasite to explore her thoughts.

BackUpDialog_35.speaker: Narrator
BackUpDialog_35.text: *Entering her mind is like boarding a sinking ship. The architecture of her consciousness buckles and collapses. Thoughts yield to a flood of overwhelming power - the elder brain.*

BackUpDialog_28.speaker: Fist Griff
BackUpDialog_28.text:
-- Do not waste - TIME - this mind cannot bear us -
- it --- turns to liquid - listen -- just LISTEN
BackUpDialog_28.context: NodeContext: Halting, glitching (the Fist is remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain that speaks through them, while also overloading their mind). Reference S_GLO_Netherbrain - this voice is halfway to that one.

003_13.speaker: Lae'zel
003_13.text: The brain seized control with the smallest of efforts. Its power must not be underestimated.

003_11.speaker: Karlach
003_11.text: The elder brain can control anyone with a tadpole. That's... concerning.

003_1.speaker: Jaheira
003_1.text: Ugh - the elder brain works its will through the worm. What other tricks has it learned?

003_5.speaker: Manip Edenosa
003_5.text: W-what... what happened? Why do I taste copper...?
003_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cracklewall's face slackens into a dazed, faraway look. She blinks and speaks, the harsh, halting croak from before now gone. NodeContext: (Cracklewall, no longer possessed) Utter confusion, as if just woken from a deep sleep. She drops dead immediately afterwards.

003_4.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
003_4.text: The elder brain uses the infected like puppets. Such tremendous power.

003_19.speaker: Wyll
003_19.text: Hells - the brain can seize infected minds. What other powers will it manifest?

003_25.speaker: Shadowheart
003_25.text: The elder brain was working her like a damn string puppet. What else is it capable of...?

003_33.speaker: Gale
003_33.text: Made into a mouthpiece by the elder brain itself. The merest taste of its manipulations, I fear.

003_35.speaker: Astarion
003_35.text: The elder brain turned her into a meat puppet. What the hells else can it do...

003_36.speaker: Minsc
003_36.text: We will be no one's fleshy vessel. Not again!

003_20.speaker: Manip Edenosa

-- necromancer - dead --- - changeling fallen --

002_0.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
002_0.text: Keep out of this, Captain. Do not forget who you serve.
002_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures to his temple on 'who you serve', in reference to a tadpole.NodeContext: Dismissive

002_3.speaker: Manip Edenosa
002_3.text: Of course, apologies. I warned them not to interfere. I...
002_3.context: NodeContext: Admonished/servile, then trailing off at the end, words failing her.

002_9.speaker: Manip Edenosa
002_9.text: Of course, I just thought you might need assistance. I...
002_9.context: NodeContext: Admonished/servile, then trailing off at the end, words failing her.

002_11.speaker: Narrator
002_11.text: *Again, you feel her tadpole, but something's... off.*

002_5.speaker: Narrator
002_5.text: *You feel an all-too-familiar squirm in the recesses of your mind - the Fist has a tadpole. But something's... off.*
002_5.context: InternalNodeContext: Only if the player did not have a moment of tadpole recognition with Cracklewall already

002_7.speaker: Manip Edenosa
002_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cracklewall's face twitches and grimaces, before speaking in a halting, croaked manner.NodeContext: A strained, angry croak (She is being remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain, which now speaks through her).

002_4.speaker: Manip Edenosa
002_4.context: NodeContext: A halting, croaked manner. (She is being remotely possessed by a powerful netherbrain, which now speaks through her).

002_12.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
002_12.text: Defective. Very well - another offering to Bhaal.
002_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: SneeringNodeContext: Pronounced 'bawl'. Recognising something's amiss.

002_6.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
002_6.text: Join us, captain. Your service is welcome.

001_4.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_4.text: We redden our steel by the light of day in His name.

001_2.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_2.text: But you are not the lamb for our slaughter.

001_12.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_12.text: It seems you've won Lady Orin's favour. Join us, in this act of slaughter. In Bhaal's name.

001_13.speaker: Player
001_13.text: I have better things to do, but you go ahead.

001_3.speaker: Player
001_3.text: I will not slaughter innocents - I will protect them from you!

001_0.speaker: Player
001_0.text: I serve no god but my own.

001_9.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_9.text: Then you betray Orin, and Bhaal himself. Your blood will spill for this.

001_10.speaker: Player
001_10.text: I serve my oath, not your Lord of Murder.

001_5.speaker: Player
001_5.text: I will join your slaughter, but not in the name of Bhaal.

001_11.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_11.text: If you say so, little lamb. If you say so.

001_7.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_7.text: You are our lamb, ready for slaughter.

001_1.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_1.text: I claim you, little lamb - for Bhaal.

001_8.speaker: Reaper of Bhaal Clotilde
001_8.text: Lady Orin asked us to test you, but I think you'll fail. What say you, little lamb?
001_8.context: NodeContext: 'My boss told me to rub it in before I kill you'
